sen.j: 小田原山 浄瑠璃寺 - 京都府木津川市にある真言律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Odawarazan Joruri-ji Temple: A Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Odawarazan Joruri-ji Temple: A Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Odawarazan Joruri-ji Temple: A Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 仏塔古寺十八尊第十番。
sen.e: It is the 10th of the 10th temple of the 18 Historical Temples with Pagodas.
It is the 10th temple of the 18 Historical Temples with Pagodas.

sen.j: 本項で後述する。
sen.e: This temple described in this article.

sen.j: 医王山 浄瑠璃寺 (松山市) - 愛媛県松山市にある真言宗の寺院。
sen.e: Iozan Joruri-ji Temple (Matsuyama City): A Shingon Sect temple located in Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture.
Iozan Joruri-ji Temple (Matsuyama City): A Shingon Sect temple located in Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture.

sen.j: 四国八十八箇所46番札所。
sen.e: It is the 46th temple of the 88 temple Shikoku Pilgrimage.
It is the 46th temple of the 88 temple Shikoku Pilgrimage.
It is the No. 46 pilgrim stamp office of the 88 Temples of Shikoku.

sen.j: 浄瑠璃寺（じょうるりじ）は、京都府木津川市加茂町にある真言律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Joruri-ji Temple is a Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kamocho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Joruri-ji Temple is a Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kamocho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Joruri-ji Temple is a Shingon Ritsu Sect temple located in Kamocho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号を小田原山と称し、本尊は阿弥陀如来と薬師如来、開基（創立者）は義明上人である。
sen.e: It was founded by Gimyo Shonin, has the honorific mountain prefix 'Odawarasan', and is dedicated to the principal images Amitabha and Bhaisajyaguru.
It was founded by Gimyo Shonin, has the honorific mountain prefix 'Odawarasan', and is dedicated to the principal images Amitabha and Bhaisajyaguru.
It was founded by Gimyo Shonin, has the honorific mountain prefix Odawarazan, and is dedicated to the principal images Amitabha and Bhaisajyaguru.

sen.j: 寺名は薬師如来の居所たる東方浄土『東方浄瑠璃世界』に由来する。
sen.e: The temple's name is derived from Bhaisajyaguru's Eastern Paradise 'Toho Joruri Sekai'.
The temple's name is derived from Bhaisajyaguru's Eastern Paradise 'Toho Joruri Sekai'.
The temple's name is derived from the Eastern Paradise "Toho Joruri Sekai" where Bhaisajyaguru lives.

sen.j: 本堂に9体の阿弥陀如来像を安置することから九体寺（くたいじ）の通称があり、古くは西小田原寺とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: The main hall has long been referred to as 'Nishiodawara-ji Temple' and is commonly called 'Kutai-ji Temple' (Temple of the Nine Images) due to the fact that it houses nine Amitabha statues.
The main hall has long been referred to as 'Nishiodawara-ji Temple' and is commonly called 'Kutai-ji Temple' (Temple of the Nine Images) due to the fact that it houses nine Amitabha statues.

The main hall has long been referred to as Nishi Odawara-ji Temple and is commonly called Kutai-ji Temple (Temple of the Nine Images) due to the fact that it houses nine Amitabha statues in the main hall.

sen.j: 緑深い境内には、池を中心とした浄土式庭園と、平安末期の本堂および三重塔が残り、平安朝寺院の雰囲気を今に伝える。
sen.e: The temple precinct retains a Heian period temple atmosphere with a Pure Land style garden centered around a pond and a main hall and three-storey pagoda remaining from the late Heian period.
The temple precinct retains a Heian period temple atmosphere with a Pure Land style garden centered around a pond and a main hall and three-storey pagoda remaining from the late Heian period.
The temple precinct retains a Heian period temple atmosphere with a Pure Land style garden centered around a pond and a main hall and three-storey pagoda remaining from the late Heian period.

sen.j: 本堂は当時京都を中心に多数建立された九体阿弥陀堂の唯一の遺構として貴重である。
sen.e: The main hall is highly valuable as the last remaining Kutai Amida-do (Hall of Nine Amitabhas) of the many that were once built around Kyoto.
The main hall is highly valuable as the last remaining Kutai Amida-do (Hall of Nine Amitabhas) of the many that were once built around Kyoto.
The main hall is highly valuable as the last remaining Kutai Amida-do (Hall of Nine Amitabhas) of the many that were once built around Kyoto.

sen.j: 堀辰雄の『浄瑠璃寺の春』にも当寺が登場する。
sen.e: Joruri-ji Temple is also featured in "Joruri-no Haru" by Tatsuo HORI.
Joruri-ji Temple is also featured in "Joruri-no Haru" by Tatsuo HORI.
Joruri-ji Temple is also featured in "Joruri-ji no Haru" (Joruri-ji Temple in spring) by Tatsuo HORI.
sen.cmt: 「Joruri-ji no Haru」とし、英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 浄瑠璃寺の所在する地区は当尾（とうの）の里と呼ばれ、付近には当尾石仏群と呼ばれる、鎌倉時代にさかのぼる石仏、石塔などが点在している。
sen.e: The area of Tono-no-sato in which Joruri-ji Temple is located is dotted with stone Buddhist statues and stone pagodas collectively known as 'Tono Sekibutsugun' that date back to the Kamakura period.
The area of Tono-no-sato in which Joruri-ji Temple is located is dotted with stone Buddhist statues and stone pagodas collectively known as 'Tono Sekibutsugun' that date back to the Kamakura period.

The area of Tono-no-sato in which Joruri-ji Temple is located is dotted with stone Buddhist statues and stone pagodas collectively known as Tono Sekibutsugun (group of stone statues in Tono) that date back to the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「当尾石仏群」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 行政的には京都府に属するが、地理的には奈良の平城京や東大寺からも近く、恭仁宮跡（奈良時代に一時期都が置かれた）や山城国分寺跡も近い。
sen.e: For administrative purposes, the area is considered to be part of Kyoto Prefecture but it is geographically close to Heijo-kyo and Todai-ji Temple in Nara, with the remains of Kuni-kyo (temporarily the capital city during the Nara period) and Yamashiro Provincial Temple also nearby.

For administrative purposes, the area is considered to be part of Kyoto Prefecture but it is geographically close to Heijo-kyo and Todai-ji Temple in Nara, with the remains of Kuni-kyo (temporarily the capital city during the Nara period) and Yamashiro Provincial Temple also nearby.

For administrative purposes, the area is considered to be part of Kyoto Prefecture but it is also close to Heijo-kyo and Todai-ji Temple in Nara geographically, with the remains of Kuni-kyo (temporarily the capital city during the Nara period) and Yamashiro Provincial Temple also nearby.
sen.cmt: 「（東大寺から）も」を補足し表現を変えました。

sen.j: 浄瑠璃寺の起源や歴史については、当寺に伝来する『浄瑠璃寺流記事』（じょうるりじるきのこと）という14世紀の記録がほぼ唯一のよりどころである。
sen.e: Essentially the only source regarding the origin and history of Joruri-ji Temple is the 14th century record "Joruri Jiruki no Koto" handed down at the temple.
Essentially the only source regarding the origin and history of Joruri-ji Temple is the 14th century record "Joruri Jiruki no Koto" handed down at the temple.

Essentially the only source regarding the origin and history of Joruri-ji Temple is the 14th century record "Joruri-ji Ruki no Koto" (records of jewels, territory, equipments of Joruri-ji Temple) handed down at the temple.
sen.cmt: 「浄瑠璃寺流記事」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: それによると、当寺は永承2年（1047年）、当麻（たいま、現・奈良県葛城市）の僧・義明上人を開基（創立者）、阿知山大夫重頼を檀那（後援者）とし、薬師如来を本尊として創建されたものであるという。
sen.e: According to this text, the first chief priest Gimyo Shonin, a monk from Taima (now Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture), and the benefactor Achiyama Tayuu Shigemori founded Joruri-ji Temple in 1047 and installed Bhaisajyaguru as the principal image.

According to this text, the first chief priest Gimyo Shonin, a monk from Taima (now Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture), and the benefactor Achiyama Tayuu Shigemori founded Joruri-ji Temple in 1047 and installed Bhaisajyaguru as the principal image.

According to this record, Joruri-ji Temple with Bhaisajyaguru as the principal image was founded by Gimyo Shonin, the first chief priest from Taima (now Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture), and Achiyama Tayu Shigemori of the benefactor, in 1047.
sen.cmt: 音引き表現などを変えました。

sen.j: 義明上人、阿知山大夫重頼の2人の人物については、詳しいことはわかっていないが、重頼は地元の小豪族であろうと推定されている。
sen.e: Few details are known about Gomyo Shonin and Achiyama Tayuu Shigemori but it is assumed that Shigemori was of a local powerful family.
Few details are known about Gomyo Shonin and Achiyama Tayuu Shigemori but it is assumed that Shigemori was from a local powerful family.
Few details are known about Gomyo Shonin and Achiyama Tayu Shigemori but it is assumed that Shigemori was from a local powerful family.
sen.cmt: 音引き表現を変えました。

sen.j: 浄瑠璃寺は九体阿弥陀如来を安置する寺として知られているが、創建当初の本尊は薬師如来であった。
sen.e: Joruri-ji Temple is known for its Kutai Amida Nyorai (Nine Amitabhas) but at the time of its founding, the principal image was Bhaisajyaguru.
Joruri-ji Temple is known for its Kutai Amida Nyorai (Nine Amitabhas) but at the time of its founding, the principal image was Bhaisajyaguru.
Joruri-ji Temple is known for its Kutai Amida Nyorai (Nine Amitabhas) but at the time of its founding, the principal image was Bhaisajyaguru.

sen.j: 九体阿弥陀如来を安置する現・本堂の建立は創建から60年後の嘉承2年（1107年）のことであった。
sen.e: The current main hall housing the Kutai Amida Nyorai statues was constructed 60 years later in 1107.
The current main hall housing the Kutai Amida Nyorai statues was constructed 60 years later in 1107.
The current main hall housing the Kutai Amida Nyorai statues was constructed in 1107, 60 years later from the foundation.
sen.cmt: 「創建から」を補足し、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 1つの堂に9体もの阿弥陀如来像を安置するという発想は「九品往生」（くほんおうじょう）思想に由来する。
sen.e: The idea to enshrine the nine Kutai Amida Nyorai within a single hall originated with the concept of 'Kuhon Ojo' (nine future lives).
The idea to enshrine the nine Kutai Amida Nyorai within a single hall originated with the concept of 'Kuhon Ojo' (nine future lives).
The idea to enshrine the nine statues of Amida Nyorai within a single hall originated with the concept of 'Kuhon Ojo' (nine future lives).

sen.j: 「九品往生」とは「観無量寿経」に説かれる思想で、極楽往生（人が現世から阿弥陀如来のいる西方極楽浄土へと生まれ変わる）のしかたには、仏の教えを正しく守る者から、極悪人まで9つの段階ないし種類があるという考えである。
sen.e: Kuhon Ojo' is advocated in the Contemplation Sutra and preaches that everyone - from those who correctly adhere to Buddhist teachings to the most evil of people must all progress through nine stages in order to achieve rebirth in paradise (rebirth from this world into Amitabha's Western Pure Land Paradise).

Kuhon Ojo' is advocated in the Contemplation Sutra and preaches that everyone - from those who correctly adhere to Buddhist teachings to the most evil of people must all progress through nine stages in order to achieve rebirth in paradise (rebirth from this world into Amitabha's Western Pure Land Paradise).

The concept of 'Kuhon Ojo' is advocated in 'Kanmuryoju-kyo' (The Sutra of Visualization of the Buddha of Measureless Life, meaning Amida), which preaches that there are nine stages or categories on Gokuraku Ojo (to rebirth from this world into Amitabha's Western Pure Land Paradise) from those who correctly adhere to Buddhist teachings to the most evil people.

sen.j: 中世から近世にかけて浄瑠璃寺は興福寺一乗院の末寺であったが、明治初期、廃仏毀釈の混乱期に真言律宗に転じ、奈良・西大寺 (奈良市)の末寺となった。
sen.e: From the medieval to modern period, Joruri-ji Temple was a branch temple of Kofuku-ji Ichijo-in Temple but it transferred to the Shingon Ritsu Sect and became a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) during the turmoil of the anti-Buddhist movement at the beginning of the Meiji era.

From the medieval to modern period, Joruri-ji Temple was a branch temple of Kofuku-ji Ichijo-in Temple but it transferred to the Shingon Ritsu Sect and became a branch temple of Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) during the turmoil of the anti-Buddhist movement at the beginning of the Meiji era.

From the medieval to modern period, Joruri-ji Temple was a branch temple of Kofuku-ji Ichijo-in Temple but it transferred to the Shingon Ritsu Sect and became a branch temple of Nara Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City) during the turmoil of the anti-Buddhist movement at the beginning of the Meiji era.

sen.j: 境内は浄土式庭園を形成している。
sen.e: The precinct has been arranged as a Pure Land Style garden.
The precinct has been arranged as a Pure Land Style garden.
The precinct has been arranged as a Pure Land Style garden.

sen.j: 境内の中心に位置する大きな池は興福寺の恵信（えしん）という僧が掘ったもので、その中央には小島があり、弁才天を祀る祠がある。
sen.e: The large pond at the center of the precinct contains a small island on which stands a small shrine dedicated to Saraswati and is said to have been dug out but a monk from Kofuku-ji Temple named Eshin.

The large pond at the center of the precinct contains a small island on which stands a small shrine dedicated to Saraswati and is said to have been dug out by a monk from Kofuku-ji Temple named Eshin.

The large pond at the center of the precinct was dug out by Eshin, a priest from Kofuku-ji Temple, and in the middle of it, a small island is placed on which stands a small shrine dedicated to Saraswati.

sen.j: 池の東岸には薬師如来を安置する和様の三重塔、西岸には阿弥陀如来を安置する本堂（九体阿弥陀堂）が位置する。
sen.e: On the eastern bank of the pond is a Japanese style three-storey pagoda housing Bhaisajyaguru and on the western bank is the main hall (Kutai Amida-do) housing Amitabha.
On the eastern bank of the pond is a Japanese style three-storey pagoda housing Bhaisajyaguru and on the western bank is the main hall (Kutai Amida-do) housing Amitabha.
A Japanese style three-storey pagoda housing Bhaisajyaguru stands on the eastern bank of the pond, and the main hall (Kutai Amida-do) housing Amitabha on the western bank.

sen.j: 薬師如来は東方浄瑠璃世界に住み、現世の苦しみを除く仏であり、阿弥陀如来は西方極楽浄土の教主である。
sen.e: It is believed that Bhaisajyaguru resides in the Eastern Pure Lapis Lazuli and serves to cure the suffering of the world, and that Amitabha is the ruler of the Western Pure Land Paradise.
It is believed that Bhaisajyaguru resides in the Eastern Pure Lapis Lazuli and serves to cure the suffering of the world, and that Amitabha is the ruler of the Western Pure Land Paradise.
It is believed that Bhaisajyaguru resides in the Eastern Pure Lapis Lazuli and serves to cure the suffering of the world, and that Amitabha is the ruler of the Western Pure Land Paradise.

sen.j: 薬師如来を東、阿弥陀如来を西に安置することにはこうした意味があり、三重塔のある東岸は「此岸」（しがん、現世）、池をはさんだ西岸は阿弥陀如来のいる「彼岸」であるという見かたもできる。
sen.e: This is the significance of housing Bhaisajyaguru in the east and Amitabha in the west, and indeed the eastern bank with its three-storey pagoda could be considered as this world while Amitabha's western bank represents nirvana.

This is the significance of housing Bhaisajyaguru in the east and Amitabha in the west, and indeed the eastern bank with its three-storey pagoda could be considered as this world while Amitabha's western bank represents nirvana.

This is the significance of housing Bhaisajyaguru in the east and Amitabha in the west, and indeed the eastern bank with its three-storey pagoda could be considered as this world while Amitabha's western bank represents nirvana.

sen.j: これら今にある伽藍の原型は、永承2年（1047年）建立の薬師如来を本尊とする本堂が取り壊され、9体の阿弥陀如来像を安置する新たな本堂が建立された嘉承2年（1107年）に形作られたものと見られる。
sen.e: The predecessor of these current structures is believed to have been the new main hall housing nine Amitabha statues constructed in 1107 after the demolition of the old main hall which was built in 1047 and housed Bhaisajyaguru as its principal image.

The predecessor of these current structures is believed to have been the new main hall housing nine Amitabha statues constructed in 1107 after the demolition of the old main hall which was built in 1047 and housed Bhaisajyaguru as its principal image.

The predecessor of these current structures is believed to have been the new main hall housing nine Amitabha statues constructed in 1107 after the demolition of the old main hall built in 1047 and housed Bhaisajyaguru as its principal image.

sen.j: 本堂（国宝）- 嘉承2年（1107年）の建立。
sen.e: Main hall (National Treasure): Constructed in 1107.
Main hall (National Treasure): Constructed in 1107.
Main hall (National Treasure): Constructed in 1107.

sen.j: 9体の阿弥陀像を横一列に安置するため、横に細長い堂である。
sen.e: The layout of the main hall is long and thin as the nine Amitabha statues are arranged in single file.
The layout of the main hall is long and thin as the nine Amitabha statues are arranged in single file.
It is a long and thin hall as the nine Amitabha statues are arranged in single file.

sen.j: 平安後期に建てられた九体阿弥陀堂は、藤原道長の造営した法成寺無量寿院をはじめ、記録に残るだけで約30棟あったとされるが、現存するものはこの浄瑠璃寺本堂のみである。
sen.e: Including the one constructed at Hojo-ji Temple Muryoju-in by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, it is thought that approximately 30 Kutai Amida-do halls were constructed during the latter part of the Heian period but the extant main hall of Joruri-ji Temple is the only one to survive.

Including the one constructed at Hojo-ji Temple Muryoju-in by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, it is thought that approximately 30 Kutai Amida-do halls were constructed during the latter part of the Heian period but the extant main hall of Joruri-ji Temple is the only one to survive.

Kutai Amida-do halls constructed during the latter part of the Heian period were said to be approximately 30 on records, including the one constructed at Hojo-ji Muryoju-in Temple by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, but the extant main hall of Joruri-ji Temple is the only one to survive.
sen.cmt: 「記録に残るだけで」を補足し、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 寄棟造りで、内部は天井を張らずに屋根裏の構造をそのまま見せた簡素なデザインになる。
sen.e: The rectangular building is topped by a hipped roof and the simple interior with no ceiling allows the construction of the inside of the roof to be seen.
The rectangular building is topped by a hipped roof and the simple interior with no ceiling allows the construction of the inside of the roof to be seen.
The hall is yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building, covered with a hipped roof) and the simple interior with no ceiling allows the construction of the inside of the roof to be seen.

sen.j: 正面は、池に面している。
sen.e: The front of the hall faces the pond.
The front of the hall faces the pond.
The front of the hall faces the pond.

sen.j: 三重塔（国宝）- 『浄瑠璃寺流記事』によると治承2年（1178年）、京都の一条大宮から移建したとするが、もともとどこの寺院にあったものか不明である。
sen.e: Three-storey pagoda: According to "Joruri Jiruki no Koto", it was relocated from Ichijo Omiya in Kyoto in 1178, but it is not known to which temple it originally belonged.
Three-storey pagoda: According to "Joruri Jiruki no Koto", it was relocated from Ichijo Omiya in Kyoto in 1178, but it is not known to which temple it originally belonged.
Three-storey pagoda (National Treasure): According to "Joruri-ji Ruki no Koto," it was relocated from Ichijo Omiya in Kyoto in 1178, but it is not known to which temple it originally belonged.
sen.cmt: 「国宝」を補足し、「Joruri-ji Ruki no Koto」としました。

sen.j: 構造上の特色は、初層内部には柱がないことで、心柱は初層の天井から立てられている。
sen.e: Its characteristic construction has no pillars on the lower floor and the central pillar extends from the ceiling of the lower floor.
Its characteristic construction has no pillars on the lower floor and the central pillar extends from the ceiling of the lower floor.
Its characteristic construction has no pillars on the lower floor and the central pillar extends from the ceiling of the lower floor.

sen.j: 浄瑠璃寺に移築された後、初層内部に仏壇を置きその上に薬師如来像（重文、秘仏）が安置された。
sen.e: After being relocated to Joruri-ji Temple, the Buddhist alter was installed in the lower floor and a statue of Bhaisajyaguru (Important Cultural Property, ordinarily hidden from public view) was placed on top.

After being relocated to Joruri-ji Temple, the Buddhist alter was installed in the lower floor and a statue of Bhaisajyaguru (Important Cultural Property, ordinarily hidden from public view) was placed on top.

After being relocated to Joruri-ji Temple, the Buddhist alter was installed in the lower floor and a statue of Bhaisajyaguru (Important Cultural Property, ordinarily hidden from public view) was placed on top.

sen.j: 周囲の壁には十六羅漢像などの壁画が描かれている。
sen.e: The surrounding walls feature paintings depicting imagery such as the sixteen Arhats.
The surrounding walls feature paintings depicting imagery such as the sixteen Arhats.
The surrounding walls feature paintings depicting imagery such as the sixteen Arhats.

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Main hall

sen.j: 三重塔
sen.e: Three-storey pagoda

sen.j: 木造阿弥陀如来坐像9体 - 平安時代後期の作。
sen.e: 9 wooden seated statues of Amitabha: Created during the latter part of the Heian period.
9 wooden seated statues of Amitabha: Created during the latter part of the Heian period.
9 wooden sedentary statues of Amitabha: Created during the latter part of the Heian period.

sen.j: 中尊は像高224.2cm、左右に各4体ずつ安置される残り8体は像高140cm前後である。
sen.e: The central image stands at 224.2cm in height and the remaining eight statues that stand four on the left and four on the right measure approximately 140cm.
The central image stands at 224.2cm in height and the remaining eight statues that stand four on the left and four on the right measure approximately 140cm.
The central image stands at 224.2 centimeters in height and the remaining eight statues that stand four on the left and four on the right measure approximately 140 centimeters in height.

sen.j: 左右の8体はほとんど同形であるが、仔細に見ると作風には微妙な違いが見られる。
sen.e: All of the eight right and left flanking statues are essentially the same but closer inspection reveals subtle differences.
All of the eight right and left flanking statues are essentially the same but closer inspection reveals subtle differences.
All of the eight right and left flanking statues are essentially the same but closer inspection reveals subtle differences.

sen.j: 中尊は上品下生印を、他8体は上品上生印をそれぞれ結んでいる。
sen.e: The central statue forms the upper grade-lower birth mudra (hand gesture), while the other eight statues form the upper grade-upper birth mudra.
The central statue forms the upper grade-lower birth mudra (hand gesture), while the other eight statues form the upper grade-upper birth mudra.
The central statue forms the upper grade-lower birth mudra (hand gesture), while the other eight statues form the upper grade-upper birth mudra.

sen.j: 9体とも寄木造。
sen.e: All nine statues have been crafted using the yosegi-zukuri technique in which the main part is made out of two or more pieces of wood.
All nine statues have been crafted using the yosegi-zukuri technique in which the main part is made out of two or more pieces of wood.
All nine statues have been crafted using the yosegi-zukuri technique in which the main part is made out of two or more pieces of wood.

sen.j: 当初の彩色文様がよく残っている。
sen.e: Much of the original colored patterns remain.

sen.j: 4体のうち広目天は東京国立博物館、多聞天は京都国立博物館に寄託。
sen.e: Of the four statues, that of Virupaksa has been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and that of Vaisravana has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum.
Of the four statues, that of Virupaksa has been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and that of Vaisravana has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum.
Of the four statues, that of Virupaksa has been deposited at Tokyo National Museum and that of Vaisravana has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum.

sen.j: 厨子入木造吉祥天立像 - 本堂安置。
sen.e: Wooden statue of Kichijoten housed within a miniature shrine: Enshrined within the main hall.
Wooden statue of Kichijoten housed within a miniature shrine: Enshrined within the main hall.
Wooden standing statue of Sri-mahadevi housed within a miniature shrine: Enshrined within the main hall.
sen.cmt: 「立像」を補足、「吉祥天」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 像高90.0cm。
sen.e: The statue stands at 90.0 centimeters in height.
The statue stands at 90.0 centimeters in height.
The statue stands at 90.0 centimeters in height.

sen.j: 檜材割矧ぎ造。
sen.e: It is made of Japanese cypress and has a hollow cavity carved inside to prevent the wood from cracking.

sen.j: 截金。

sen.j: 附像内納入品吉祥天摺仏（59枚）、革製厨子金具形残欠（8片）。
sen.e: Its Important Cultural Property designation also includes printed images (59 in total) of Kichijoten placed within the statue and an incomplete leather fitting on the miniature shrine.
Its Important Cultural Property designation also includes printed images (59 in total) of Kichijoten placed within the statue and an incomplete leather fitting on the miniature shrine.
It also includes printed images of Kichijoten (59 in total) placed within the statue and an incomplete leather fitting on the miniature shrine (8 pieces).

sen.j: 平安朝風の優美な作風の像であるが、『浄瑠璃寺流記事』によれば実際の制作は鎌倉時代の建暦2年（1212年）である。
sen.e: Despite the statue's elegant Heian period Imperial style, "Joruri Jiruki no Koto" states that it was actually created in 1212 during the Kamakura period.
Despite the statue's elegant Heian period Imperial style, "Joruri Jiruki no Koto" states that it was actually created in 1212 during the Kamakura period.
Despite the statue's elegant Heian period Imperial style, "Joruri-ji Ruki no Koto" states that it was in fact created in 1212 during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「Joruri-ji Ruki no Koto」としました。"actually"→"in fact"に変更しました。

sen.j: 仏教尊像としての威厳と、現実の女性を思わせる官能美が見事に調和した作品である。
sen.e: The statue is a magnificently crafted piece with both the solemn dignity of a venerated Buddhist image and a beauty that it is reminiscent of a real woman.
The statue is a magnificently crafted piece with both the solemn dignity of a venerated Buddhist image and a beauty that is reminiscent of a real woman.
The statue is a magnificently crafted piece with both the solemn dignity of a venerated Buddhist image and a beauty that is reminiscent of a real woman.

sen.j: 九体阿弥陀の中尊の向かって左に置かれた厨子内に安置され、春、秋、正月の一定期間のみ扉が開かれる秘仏である（公開は1月1日-1月15日、3月21日-5月20日、10月1日-11月30日）。
sen.e: This hidden statue is enshrined within the miniature shrine that is sits to the left of the central statue of the nine Amitabha statues as faced from the front, and is only revealed at certain times during spring, autumn and in January (displayed from January 1st-15th, March 21st-May 20th, October 1st-November 30th).

This hidden statue is enshrined within the miniature shrine so that it sits to the left of the central statue of the nine Amitabha statues as faced from the front, and is only revealed at certain times during spring, autumn and in January (displayed from January 1st-15th, March 21st-May 20th, October 1st-November 30th).

This hidden statue is enshrined within the miniature shrine so that it sits to the left of the central statue of the nine Amitabha statues as faced from the front, and is only revealed at certain times during spring, autumn and in January (displayed from January 1 - 15, March 21 - May 20, October 1 - November 30).
sen.cmt: 年月の表記を変えました。

sen.j: 本像を納める厨子の扉に描かれた仏画も鎌倉時代の絵画資料として貴重なものである。
sen.e: The Buddhist images adorning the doors of the miniature shrine that houses this statue are valuable as examples of Kamakura period painting.
The Buddhist images adorning the doors of the miniature shrine that houses this statue are valuable as examples of Kamakura period painting.
The Buddhist images adorning the doors of the miniature shrine that houses this statue are valuable as examples of Kamakura period painting.

sen.j: ただし、オリジナルの厨子扉は明治初期に流出して東京芸術大学の所蔵となっており、浄瑠璃寺にあるのは模写である。
sen.e: However, the miniature shrine doors at Joruri-ji Temple are reproductions as the originals were removed during the early Meiji era and came to be owned by the Tokyo University of the Arts
However, the miniature shrine doors at Joruri-ji Temple are reproductions as the originals were removed during the early Meiji era and came to be owned by Tokyo University of the Arts
However, the miniature shrine doors at Joruri-ji Temple are reproductions as the originals were removed during the early Meiji era and came to be owned by Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補足しました。

sen.j: 厨子の正面と左右の扉には梵天・帝釈天、四天王が、後壁には弁才天を中心に、四眷属像が描かれている。
sen.e: The central, left and right doors depict Brahma, Sakra and the Four Heavenly Kings respectively, and the rear wall depicts four disciples centered around Benzaiten.
The central, left and right doors depict Brahma, Sakra and the Four Heavenly Kings respectively, and the rear wall depicts four disciples centered around Benzaiten.

sen.j: 公開は毎月8日、彼岸中日、正月三が日のみ。

sen.j: 三重塔初重壁画16面 - 十六羅漢図像は、平安時代の絵画資料として貴重。

sen.j: 塔前のものには「貞治五年（1366）丙午正月十一日造立之為法界衆生願主阿闍梨祐実」の銘が刻まれている。
sen.e: The one in front of the pagoda is carved with an inscription reading 'Created on the 11th day of the 1st month of the 5th year of the Joji era (1466, prayer for all sentient beings of the universe offered by Preceptor Sukezane'.
